segments.text: Professor Wang , what is non-tariff barrier ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Non-tariff barrier is another mean to restrict imports .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: For example , some countries restrict imports by quantitative restriction .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: This is used to protect local industries or to achieve certain political objectives .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Technical barriers are set for imported goods .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: This is designed to exclude them from domestic market , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , some countries may use some of the unnecessary health rules to exclude foreign food .
segments.speaker: S2
